subject: Integrating Jemmy and JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi, Has anyone tried and succeeded in integrating Jemmy (jemmy.netbeans.org) with JUnit? What I m thinking of is a subclass of TestCase which allows to run
messageBody:
Hi,

Has anyone tried and succeeded in integrating Jemmy (jemmy.netbeans.org)
with JUnit?
What I'm thinking of is a subclass of TestCase which allows to run Jemmy
scenarios and record all AssertionFailures and Jemmy return codes != 0.

Johannes
